availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John J. Cornwell (Washington County, Indiana, farmer and blacksmith)

body.p: Washington County, Indiana, farmer. Kentucky native. Married Minerva J. Williams Cornwell in Oldham County, Kentucky on October 30, 1842. Father of Benjamin Cornwell, Benonia Cornwell, Charles Cornwell, Jacob Cornwell, and John A Cornwell. Farmer in Orange County, Indiana in 1850. Master blacksmith in Washington County, Indiana in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Orange County, Paoli, p. 444A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, County, Brown, p. 112.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Oldham County Marriages, Film #000482447, p. 623.
Find A Grave, "Minerva Jane Cornwell (1816-1899)," Memorial #209096427, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/209096427 (accessed September 9, 2020).
